questions.question: The first "act" or tax to be placed on the colonists was

choices.answer: Tea Act
Stamp Act
Townsend Act
Sugar Act

questions.question: Why did British Parliament pass the Sugar tax on colonists?

choices.answer: To pay for the exploration of more land
To pay for the debt caused by the French and Indian War
To pay for the cost of building more ships
So British Parliament would receive higher salaries

questions.question: On what goods did the Townsend Act place a tax?

choices.answer: Coffee, tea, and wine
Stamps
Glass, lead, and paint
Every home in the town

questions.question: The purpose of the Tea Act was to

choices.answer: Increase sales for the East India Tea Company
Encourage the Colonists to drink more coffee
Punish the Colonists for The Boston Tea Party
Provide the Colonists with free tea as an apology

questions.question: How did the Colonists protest the Townsend Act

choices.answer: Painted their homes red
Broke all glass windows in the town
Boycotted British imports
Boycotted the Boston Harbor

questions.question: The Stamp Act forced Colonists to

choices.answer: Purchase expensive newspapers
Stamp their belongings with their last names
Mail all important documents
Purchase a stamp to be placed on all paper products

questions.question: Which of the following was a result of the Stamp Act

choices.answer: Britain fought a war against France and Spain
Colonists demand for "no taxation without representation"
Britain withdrew troops from the colonies
Colonists unite to fight French and Indian War

questions.question: What event caused King George to pass the Intolerable Acts

choices.answer: The French and Indian War
The Boston Massacre
The Tea Act
The Boston Tea Party

questions.question: As a result of the Intolerable Acts,

choices.answer: The First Continental Congress was formed
The first group of women were elected to congress
Great Britain forfeited the war
King George apologized for his behavior
